results.title: The Eureka Story
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Tom, a year 9 student from Ballarat, completed this story about the causes for the battle “…because it is the most interesting part”.

results.title: A Desperate case
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A cautionary tale of a typical holiday suitcase. Crammed beyond its capacity, imperfectly fastened, inadequately and confusedly labelled, the railways transport it from station to station, seeking its true abode. Finally, one of its owners comes to the nightmare tribunal where those who maltreat their luggage are dealt with. Did it happen? Was it a dream? Be warned. See this film. Avoid making yours a desperate case.

results.title: A Day with a Japanese family
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Toei
results.brief_description: Depicts the daily life of an average Japanese family; shows their living conditions, problems, and the family relationships. The new Japan is improving living for the vast population and this film emphasises the benefits a family enjoys in the expanding industrial nation.

results.title: A Day of healing
results.creator_credit: Allan Dickes, Associated World Public Relations and Filmcentre (Melbourne)
results.brief_description: Starting with a little of the history of the Austin Hospital, Melbourne, the film quickly moves into the day to day workings of the hospital and many of its special treatment departments - including the kitchen which prepares 2500 meals a day.

results.title: A Day in the desert
results.brief_description: Contrary to common opinion the desert supports a profusion of wildlife. Desert flora and fauna all exhibit adaptations to retain, prevent loss of, or derive small amounts of water. In this film specialised survival techniques which permit the withstanding of long periods of drought and extreme temperature changes are studied in the horned toad, badger, peccary, gila woodpecker, various species of desert birds, spiders, snakes and a variety of plants and other animals.

results.title: A Day in the Death of Joe Egg (The Handicapped Person in The
results.brief_description: Film content is scenes from the play “A Day In The Death of Joe Egg” by Peter Nichols. It provides an extremely rich and provocative learning resource in which the actors role-play sketches within the play to caricature situations faced by parents of a handicapped child Cast includes Romona Kaye, Harriet Buchan, Jack Shepherd.

results.title: A Day at the dump
results.brief_description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. Depicts the conditions before funds for a comprehensive waste disposal program were made available. (The solution is presented in “Burn, bury or what?”)

results.title: A Current of electricity
results.brief_description: An explanation in detail of the fundamental principal of electricity, making extensive use of animated diagrams to show the structure of, an movement in, atoms.

results.title: A Crutch for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and Burt Martin Associates
results.brief_description: An examination of the personal dependencies of three young people - for Frank the crutch was liquor, for Billy it was pot, for Max it was hard stuff. Each becomes involved in tragedy and each, at the brink, turns back from his false dependency.

results.title: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and National Indian Arts and Crafts
results.brief_description: Deanna Skye, a Cayuga Indian, is one of the few that still carries on the beautiful craft of making corn husk dolls using materials gathered from nature. Pause for a while with an Indian mother as she makes a corn husk doll for her child.
results.title_for_label: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye
